intro: Taraxacum lilaceum, commonly known as the pink dandelion, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped, hairy leaves and a bright pink to purple flower head that resembles a dandelion. The plant produces a hollow, spiky stem that supports the flower and is often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is commonly found in meadows and along stream banks. The species is notable for its ornamental value and its role in supporting pollinators.
